oai_dc:dc.dc:title: York family, Gov. Cooper, and crowd at movie premiere

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hotels; Motion picture theaters; Governors; Heroes

Storer, Walter Henry, 1898-; Knickerbocker Theatre (Nashville, Tenn.); Hermitage Hotel (Nashville, Tenn.) -- History; Cooper, Prentice, 1895-1969; York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; Sergeant York (Motion picture)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 35mm slide showing a tightly packed group of dignitaries and onlookers. Sgt. York and Gov. Cooper can be identified in the center; Gracie York is partially hidden. Red, white, and blue banners hang from the building and a convertible automobile. The automobile sports a sign reading, "Welcome Sergeant York." The original awning of the Hermitage Hotel is at upper right.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Dr. Walter H. Storer Photograph Collection, ca. 1930-1955
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These photographs were taken by Dr. Walter Henry Storer, an amateur photographer who was a Vanderbilt University professor of romance languages. Nashville's Knickerbocker Theatre opened March 22, 1916, and closed February 4, 1961. The Hermitage Hotel (named for Andrew Jacksons estate) opened on Saturday, September 17, 1910.
